Barry Awards
The Barry Awards, voted on by the readers of Deadly Pleasures , are presented at the annual Bouchercon World Mystery Convention. The awards began in 1997 and are named in honor of Barry Gardner, well-known fan reviewer.

2017 Nominees

Best Novel
  °  Where It Hurts by Reed Farrel Coleman [ review ]
  °  The Wrong Side of Goodbye by Michael Connelly
  °  The Second Life of Nick Mason by Steve Hamilton [ review ]
  °  Wilde Lake by Laura Lippman
  °  A Great Reckoning by Louise Penny
  °  The Second Girl by David Swinson [ review ]

Best First Novel
  °  Dodgers by Bill Beverl y [ review ]
  °  I’m Traveling Alone by Samuel Bjork [ review ]
  °  IQ by Joe Ide [ review ]
  °  The Drifter by Nicholas Petrie [ review ]
  °  I’m Thinking of Ending Things by Iain Reid
  °  Missing, Presumed by Susie Steiner [ review ]

Best Paperback Original
  °  Under the Harrow by Flynn Berry [ review ]
  °  The Heavens May Fall by Allen Eskens [ review ]
  °  The Queen’s Accomplice by Susan Elia MacNea l
  °  The Darkest Secret by Alex Marwood [ review ]
  °  Rain Dogs by Adrian McKinty [ review ]
  °  The Girl in the Window by Jake Needham

Best Thriller
  °  Overwatch by Matthew Betley
  °  First Strike by Ben Coes
  °  Guilty Minds by Joseph Finder
  °  Back Blast by Mark Greaney
  °  The One Man by Andrew Gross
  °  Collecting the Dead by Spencer Kope [ review ]
